website_summaries.verdict: Cruelty-free method for suctioning up almost any bug that doesn't move too fast.
pros: Product extends around 3 ft. to capture bugs on windowsills and other hard-to-reach spots
Chamber holds around 25 large bugs before needing to be emptied
Many reports that product lasts years, even with daily use
Not battery operated or powered by electricity
Particularly loved by those with stinkbug problems
cons: Some users experienced problems with trap door on chamber

customer_reviews.title: Trap Door is the weak point!! replacement parts have PROHIBITIVE shipping cost!
customer_reviews.text: Look, this thing works great, while it stays in one piece. We have had ours 2 months, then the little trap door at the end broke. This is the weak point, and of course, the company will sell you a replacement, but only from their website, and it will cost you $20, YES $20 to get one little trap door shipped to you. It's cheaper to just buy another whole unit. My wife uses it so much that I will buy another one, but if it breaks again forget it. I would have given this thing 4 or 5 stars if the company sold replacement parts at a reasonable price (again outrageous shipping charge!).
customer_reviews.author: David H.

customer_reviews.title: We LOVE Bug-zooka!!!
customer_reviews.text: We love Bug-zooka! So, why one star? The little hinged doors break. And, I understand that buying that replacement part is $25. So, you might as well just get another Bug-zooka. Last year we bought two for our terrible stink bug problem. It worked like a charm. The first one lasted several months before the hinges broke so we put a paper towel with a rubber band over the end and kept using it. Just this week we opened the new one and it lasted exactly one day. This little bug eater is perfect except that it's defective. It wouldn't be so bad if you could order a replacement part reasonably.
customer_reviews.author: Weevie

customer_reviews.title: I have 4 of these.  They've now ruined them!  (see pic)
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 of these for work, home, vacation home, mother's home. They *were great. No fussy motors or batteries to deal with. If there's a bug you can suck it up without touching it or splattering its guts everywhere. But they've now made them with large gaps in the chamber. If you suck up small spiders or other smaller bugs they can easily crawl right back out. It ships with 2 different suction chambers. The other one was probably worse in that there is also a gap in the middle flaps. (I didn't get a pic of that one.)
customer_reviews.author: E. B.

customer_reviews.title: Might work, but I won't know.
customer_reviews.text: It is very possible that the Bugzooka works and is a good product. Mine arrived with a small part damaged (tiny spring door in clear tip broken) so I needed it replaced. Manufacturer referred me to seller, who referred me to manufacturer, who referred me to seller again. I just wanted a small replacement part. I will pack it up and bring into town to mail for refund - the only option I have. *Update: I see they SELL the tiny part I need on their website for $2.99. Should really be part of their warranty to send me that tiny part to replace the one that arrived defective.
customer_reviews.author: Yve Yve

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Mother, who is visiting and discovered Palmetto Bugs for the first time. If you don't know, they're huge and hideous, so she was understandably freaked out. She now has this sucker cocked and ready at all times should she encounter another. I love the fact that you can grab and dispose of them without ever touching them..especially at a distance. I wish there were a smaller model that can be used for flies!
customer_reviews.author: Jason F

customer_reviews.title: This won't do. You can have it back
customer_reviews.text: This one has flimsy trap doors that came in a 'collapsed' position, i.e., compromised. Any stinging bugs would climb right out and escape, or worse, seek revenge with a bite! All four previous ones I purchased have rigid plastic trap doors that close tight plus tiny springs at the hinge of each of the two trap doors that hold the trap door in place at a sealed position. (The actual suction mechanism did not disappoint, works as well as my other older ones.) I will attempt to resolve this with the seller. Stay tuned...
customer_reviews.author: Anna C.

customer_reviews.title: Worked a few times then completely useless
customer_reviews.text: This was great the first few times I used it, "zapping" japanese beetles off my plants. But it quickly lost it's suction and I've tried unsuccessfully to find the problem or fix it. The suction just got lower and lower. Unfortunately this was a couple months after purchase so not eligible for return; yet for the ridiculous price I paid for a few cheap pieces of plastic I expected much better.
customer_reviews.author: a nice person in MI

customer_reviews.title: Tip already broke
customer_reviews.text: The spring loaded trap door on the tip already broke. The most important part for keeping the "critter in there". Bought this as a gift for my mother. Dissapointed in this product it looked promising.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Trap doors do not keep bugs in.
customer_reviews.text: 2 stars maybe generous as the whole pint is thebkeep the bug trapped. The product would have been fine if the trap doors would remain closed. The small springs tasked with keeping the doors closed were pushed to the side and mis aligned with the doors. This allows the doors to flop open and closed freely. I have tried to push the springs back into place but the pop right back off the doors. They need to be secured in someway. It's simply a poor design.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: They redesigned the doors!!
customer_reviews.text: After reading multiple reviews of people complaining that the plastic doors break, I hesitated to buy this. Then I was ambushed by a massive spider blessed with Olympian speed, and I decided it was worth the chance. And low and behold, to my delight, the Bugzooka arrived with redesigned rubbery/soft plastic doors, instead of the breakable hard plastic that had been the subject of earlier complaints! Brilliant! And it works awesomely. And awesomely is a word. Anyone who doesn't want to get up close and personal with creepy intruders (meaning insects and spiders, though I suppose you could use it to bash a human intruder on the head, as well) should invest in one of these. Five. Stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jolie Hales

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thinking it would suction the bugs into a container, but it really doesn't work. It has enough air for one quick burst and if you miss the bug (which is likely), then you have to reset the pump and try again. I mailed it back. No problem with the return.
customer_reviews.author: ellysiab

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this thing. But alas, it just doesn't do the job. It works great if the bug is dead, but you have to practically touch the bug before "firing", so any bug with any life to it is going to escape before you can suck it up.
customer_reviews.author: T. Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Not humane, bulky
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a bug vacuum that would gently collect insects so I could release them outside. Most of what I was able to catch either got badly injured or killed. I'm generally not afraid of insects, but using a jar and a piece of paper is a pain. I was hoping for something quick and easy. It's also very bulky. It can make it hard to position it just right before the bug moved and you can hit the trigger.
customer_reviews.author: LT1223

customer_reviews.title: Weak suction makes for poor bug capture
customer_reviews.text: Great idea on paper, but poor execution. This device is only good for catching something the size of an ant or fly. Anything bigger and it's a hit or miss. The suction just isn't that strong for big insects. You take a chance with flying stinging insects, as it's hard to get close to a wasp and not have it fly away, or attack you. Depending on the bug's size...it's a 50/50 chance that this thing will work as advertised. And it doesn't help that you practically have to put the capture nozzle literally right to the insect to capture it (literally impossible for bugs that fly)
customer_reviews.author: tanpan

customer_reviews.title: Was so excited and now I’m bummed that it doesn’t live up to its name
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to add the bugzooka to my bug killing arsenal, but unfortunately, it has not worked on a single bug yet. I have tried to suck up small bugs and larger bugs and it hasn’t come close to sucking them up. I followed all of the directions but still have not had any luck. I am bummed that I spent so much for this and it has turned out to just basically be an interesting looking tube that can shorten and extend.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Wasserman

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! Found a Mama spider in the process of birthing. She got out only a couple babies before we found and nabbed her. We placed her outside on a nice bush in a hidden place and found that the mama AND the babies made it! I was very concerned and wanted to move her safetly without becoming a foster home for 1500 new borns. Thats way more children than my clost can handle. Works on all types of bugs too including the big june bugs that stink when you squash em. It's a great way to be humane without having to get near them.
customer_reviews.author: Paul M. Kelly Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Unusually well-designed.  Works perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: This inexpensive gadget is one of those rare novelty inventions that actually work exactly as intended. I've had mine for a couple of years and use it often, to yank living bugs off the floor or walls, and to suck up dead ones (as well as the occasional piece of lint). I'm especially impressed with how nicely the thing is designed and engineered; the clear plastic nozzle at the end fits tightly but comes off easily when you want to empty it. P.S. Another nice thing is that it doesn't use batteries or an electric cord. There's nothing you have to keep charged.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Does a good job sucking up stinkbugs
customer_reviews.text: Our problem is mainly stinkbugs. Not much luck with the plans of attack you hear about -- like attracting them to drown in a bowl of water with dish detergent added. Finally, BugZooka gives us a tool that works well to vacuum up and contain these critters (and easily empty them). And no batteries required!!! No more need to try to pick them up in a wad of toilet tissue, etc. P.S. So far, so good, but we're going to try to be careful with the little plastic trap doors at the end. I can see how they could be the weak link, as some reviewers have described, in an otherwise great product.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa B.

customer_reviews.title: So simple, so elegant, so effective, so well made. Fantastic for arachnophobic people.
customer_reviews.text: Teenager who naturally stays up late has stopped waking us late at night to kill spiders. When I wake up in the morning if the Bugzooka is sitting outside the bedroom door I know there is something in it. I take the catch chamber out and release whatever critter it is in the garden and return the cartridge clean and empty. Far more effective than loud battery powered low suction bugvacs. One big gulp of air draws in whatever you get this close to. Yesterday I easily snuck up and captured one of those pesky house flies that are hard to catch even with zappy tennis rackets.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great especially if you fear bugs.
customer_reviews.text: I hate stink bugs and I have a severe phobia of flying insects. I literally would lock myself in another room because I just couldn't catch stink bugs. When I saw a stink bug, I would go to another room and wait until my husband would get home to catch it hoping it was still there. I don't have to wait for my husband anymore, I can easily catch the stink bugs with BugZooka. This product is a lifesaver for my fear and anxiety of those darn stink bugs. Excellent product and definitely recommend. Easy to catch them from a distance and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Charlton

customer_reviews.title: This tool sucks! For a while, then it doesn't!
customer_reviews.text: Well for a few weeks it worked fine, then the trigger started sticking and then it didn't work at all. I notified Amazon, they accepted the return but only provided a scan code which could only be used at a proper UPS Store which the closest is 50 miles away! I went back to the Amazon return page, canceled the return to try to restart the return, but now the page says that my return window is closed and I cannot return the crappy vacuum! Now this really sucks!
customer_reviews.author: Ol blue

customer_reviews.title: Works but kills bugs. Not catch-release.
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm sucking up bugs but sadly it seems to kill them instantly. I wanted this as a catch-release tool since I don’t like killing bugs. Not sure I can even use it now unless I feel it’s a really hearty bug. Crane flies don’t stand a chance. : (
customer_reviews.author: tgr74

customer_reviews.title: Great for slow moving bugs - wouldn't work with flies
customer_reviews.text: We have an antique home, so ... lots of places bugs can get in apparently. This fall/winter we have had a major invasion of stink bugs. Creepy! This tool has been fantastic. We do need to stand on something to get anything on the ceiling - not long enough for that. It gets stink bugs the first time, every time. What I really like about it is that we don't have to clean it out every time. I emptied the other day with probably 15 bugs in it. They just die (no stink) . Pop the top off and knock it outside on the window sill and you're done. So far no problems with flimsy flaps that others have reported.
customer_reviews.author: T. Beaulieu

customer_reviews.title: Great for people who are too afraid to squish a bug
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought this for himself, when Im not available to squish a bug for him! For those with bug fears its great to stay an arms length away and just suck the sucker up! Or if you're short, in my case, if a bug is out of reach, and there's no stool available, again another solution. It is quite hilarious to use, but it seriously does the trick and you can feel all powerful with your BugZooka around. My husband got this as a gift for several people. He is a true fan and so am I!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay C

customer_reviews.title: You Need This Outstanding Bug Catcher!
customer_reviews.text: We have had other "guns" to catch bugs...but nothing compares to this one! We use it at camp to catch, stink bugs, large mosquitoes, spiders, beetles and even flies. It is actually fun to use and allows you to catch and release while never having to touch the bugs or use any toxic sprays. Several others at camp tried ours and liked it so much, they bought their own. This is sturdy, requires no batteries, and is totally worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Betty Boopadoop

customer_reviews.title: Spectacular bug solution
customer_reviews.text: I'm deathly afraid of spiders and other bugs aren't my favorite either -- however, my building is old and attracts a variety of creepy crawlies. I've used this thing to catch everything from mosquitos and mosquito-eaters to spiders and unidentified flying buggers! The telescoping tube is about the best thing ever because I can reach things that fly up high, and I don't have to get too close to spiders to trap them. The other great part is that if the bug is substantial enough (so excluding gnats, mosquito[eaters], stuff like that), it will survive the initial vacuum process and can chill in the chamber until you're ready to take it outside and set it free. No killing necessary!
customer_reviews.author: K.E.

customer_reviews.title: BEST bug catcher ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the BEST bug catcher I've ever used. I have bought rechargeable battery bug catchers with a long tube that cost a lot more and left the spider on the wall or just knocked them down. The Bugzooka catches flies on the first attempt. Spiders ...they're sucked right up. Stink bugs, they're history. I ut the tube in the freezer and empty it later. Easy peasy. I've released some flies outside ... But spiders and stink bugs...no mercy!!! This thing makes bug catching actually fun !!
customer_reviews.author: N. Ganshorn

customer_reviews.title: Older Version Better
customer_reviews.text: This product is awesome but the newer versions, including the one I purchased, the trap doors are flimsy, so they don't stay shut. This allows the bugs to get back out! But if you store it upside down (with trap doors on the floor) it solves the problem. Love the older versions of this product, but the new trap doors make it not as practical
customer_reviews.author: Harleigh

customer_reviews.title: Angry spiders will attack you.
customer_reviews.text: It's easy to miss, and when you do, the spider will quickly jump on your neck and bite bite bite! Ok, just kidding. This thing is fun, and makes it safe clean and easy to dispose of the creepy crawlers in your house. Nice that there's no batteries etc.. Spiders pop into a little clear tube at the end. It's removable so you can return them to nature, or let them die and dump into the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Beazle

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Product!!!.It holds quite a bit of dead and live stink bugs.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the BugZooka and I love it to catch live stinks bugs and pick up all the dead ones. It also nice length to reach further for short people like me and whoever doesn't want to get close to these awful stink bugs. I bought this along with the Terro T3500 Stink Bug Spray, that spray product did not kill stink bugs on immediately on contact but I sprayed the spray in cracks around windows and doors where I thought they might be coming in at and the next day 100's of dead stink bugs on the floor around areas I sprayed the previous day.
customer_reviews.author: Erin P

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding product!
customer_reviews.text: Spiders, hornets, etc. are at the mercy of this! Press the plunger in just before using (leave it relaxed for storage), get the tip within an inch or so of the critter, press the button and POP, it's in the container on the tip. After 4.5 years, the screw on the end came loose. One Allen Wrench and a Phillips screwdriver later, I had it apart and screwed back together. Very well designed and was easy to fix. And I have used it a LOT over those 4.5 years. My wife and kids HATE bugs.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Harbath

customer_reviews.title: OMG Buy this now, the ONLY thing that works for these devils
customer_reviews.text: Live in Upstate, NY and have caught about 30 of these bugs per day. This is the only thing that works. Have had no luck with chemicals. There are no batteries you just load the device with potential energy and get close to the bug. Hit the button and it sucks them up for disposal from either natural causes over a couple days or otherwise. Do not use a powered vacuum as it will smell. Buy this. I had been using this for months and getting more bugs now in the Spring. Just bought a second for backup cuz if the first unit dies, I will be SOL. Thanks for coming up with this.
customer_reviews.author: J Woodcock

customer_reviews.title: Best thing to deal with pesky stink bugs.
customer_reviews.text: Super simple to operate and the greatest invention ever to deal with stink bugs. The little “screen door” that pops open to catch the bugs and keep them trapped does seem flimsy as other people mention, but I guess that’s the only way to have it pop open by the air pressure mechanism used to trap the bugs. I haven’t had any issues with it whatsoever though, as one isn’t supposed to touch the door at all, so I don’t see it being a problem. Have easily captured over 50 bugs since I got it and it’s still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: J. Franco

customer_reviews.title: Best weapon against stink bugs!
customer_reviews.text: This fall we were invaded by stinkbugs. Stink bugs were waiting outside my deck door just waiting for an opportunity to get inside. Prior to the bugzooka, we would grab the stink bug with a paper towel, squeeze them to crush them and throw them in the trash can. The smell must have been drawing more bugs. With the bugzooka, we suck up the bugs, keep them in the chamber and flush down the toilet when we run out of space. Within a couple of days the stinkbug problem improved by 75%!
customer_reviews.author: Momma C

customer_reviews.title: Best invention ever!
customer_reviews.text: i can't handle bugs, and i live alone. this is the best thing EVER! this is my second one, my old one just broke and i've had it, for a long LONG time, many years! maybe practice with a small piece of paper to see the angle and how close to get to bug. i had this horrible flying cockroach, NEVER knew they FLY! it landed on the edge of my picture frame, i approached slowly and GOT HIM! first try! and he was pretty big! i LOVE the Bugzooka! BEST EVER!
customer_reviews.author: L. Santos

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: It's a waste of money doesn't suck up a bug in less you put it right up on top of the bug and that's if the bug doesn't take off first
customer_reviews.author: Bobbyjospain

customer_reviews.title: Stink bugs (and spiders) BEWARE!!!
customer_reviews.text: I put it together as soon as it was delivered and didn't have to wait long to find a victim. I found two stink bugs together in a window, and wondered if I'd have to remove them separately. I put the tip up to the closest one, and to my amazement, they were both sucked up together! How cool! Where has this wonderful invention been all my life? I then took the catch tube and dumped their sorry little carcasses into a container of soapy water, which kills them instantly. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Laurie A.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Last Long
customer_reviews.text: This thing works but it doesn't last long if you use it a lot, which I do. If you could buy repair parts it would be a 5 star product. So since this one has only lasted from Oct 2019 to May 3, about 6 months, I am ordering a different but similar product to try this time.
customer_reviews.author: jan

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Where has this thing been all my life? My neighbor told me about this and I thought she was buts because it was so expensive. I splurged since I’ve got two kiddos that flip out about creepy crawly critters and this thing does the trick. Catch those bugs from a distance and let them go or rinse them out in the sink. Two different attachments - one for those that want to analyze and see their catch and a tinted one for those that want to look away.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah E Avallone

customer_reviews.title: Works Great But Fragile
customer_reviews.text: This product does exactly what it's supposed to, it sucks the bugs into the tube to be released outdoors or disposed of. Just be careful because the little doors at the tip when the bugs go in come off their little spings rather easily. All I did was tap it against the wall and one of them dislodged. They are able to be repaired with a little disassembly and patience in getting the spring back into position.
customer_reviews.author: Jason H

customer_reviews.title: Not for big bugs
customer_reviews.text: We get a lot of moths flying around our ceiling, issue is they are BIG moths and this thing does not at all suck them up. It has worked for spiders and smaller moths but the big boys just fly away no matter how close the opening is. We also had to remove the trap door on the end to get any medium sized bug any chance of getting inside without hurting it. I usually then just cover the opening with my hand and set the whole thing outside till it leaves.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha L.

customer_reviews.title: Love this and it works.......
customer_reviews.text: I just totally love this. So easy to use and it does work. With the now stink bug showing up, got tired of using a tissue to catch them as you can't use a flyswatter or else you get to smell their name. Whomever invented this is a genius as I also use it for catching other insects that come into our house from flies, to wasps, yellow jackets and so on. A really great puchase and no batteries required. You catch and can do whatever you want with the bug, release or do away with. My sister bought one and told me how great it works, showed me in fact so I purchased one also. Very happy I did.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy W

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I love this device; generally works and is very easy to use. I have now bought three of these. Why three? Because the plastic little doors that hold the insect in wear out very fast and I didn't realize until I bought the third one that you can order replacement parts from for this for cheap from inexplicably - a company named trimaxlocks. Just search bugzooka on their main page for the replacement parts. I ordered a number of the replacement trap doors; so much better than buying a whole new one.
customer_reviews.author: Just a mom

customer_reviews.title: Works great, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Works by precompressed spring force to create an instant vacuum (suction) at the tip to draw a bug inside the tip. Does not kill them, so bugs can be released outside. Works great for slow moving Box Elder Bugs inside the house. Hard to catch flies because they move so fast.
customer_reviews.author: bherch

customer_reviews.title: This Thing is Way Fun!
customer_reviews.text: First, it is well made. I like that it's pneumatic, no motors or batteries to replace or recharge. It is true that you have to be practically right on the bug to get it, but I've found that if I approach bugs from behind, even flies, it gets them no problem. Also, the telescoping tube makes for a long reach. I can get bugs off the high ceiling easily, which was impossible with all of the electric vac models I have tried.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Great for bug phobics and kids!!!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve never in my life written an amazon review for anything. Until now. I am afraid of spiders and bees. Yes I am an adult. Yes it is irrational. To the point... This product was purchased to get a handle on drink bugs in my house. It takes getting used to, as you have to get really really close to the bug to trap it, but once you have the hang of it the product works so well! I’ve even caught spiders and wasps with this product ON MY OWN (granted partially shaking in fear). My daughter, who is 2, loves observing the bugs in the catch tube before we release them. Wonderful product, happy to have it!
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe how simple and effective this product is. I live in the woods and my house is regularly invaded by insects. Preferring the humane way of capture, the ideal device for this had eluded me until now. It works very well and bugs are captured unharmed. I read in the reviews and saw that the hinged trap doors easily break so I am exerting care not to touch them and purchased the additional warranty should anything happen. I also saved the box should I need to send the unit in for repair. So far, so good!
customer_reviews.author: Victoria S. Haeselbarth

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous
customer_reviews.text: Should have reviewed years ago! Love, love, love this! I am on my second Bugzooka as I used my first one so much that it gave out. I haven't looked back to see when I bought the first one but it had to be over 10 years ago and I bought the current one a couple of years so. Does exactly what is advertised. I don't like killing bugs if I don't have to and this is perfect (moths I still have to catch with a glass, they are too delicate). I bought it for my stepmom several years ago, one for an elderly neighbor two years ago and just recommended it to my sister-in- law.
customer_reviews.author: A. Anthony

customer_reviews.title: A nice product
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice product. I only gave it 4 stars because the little clear trap doors at the end of the product have a tendency to stay open. That's the only downside of this product, although I have successfully used it to catch leaf-legged stink bugs, vine borer beetles, and a large spider. The trap doors sometimes stick in the open position and so far it hasn't kept me from getting some bugs off out of my vegetable garden. The vacuum mechanism is actually very well made and I still use it even with the limitation.
customer_reviews.author: rebelbuc

customer_reviews.title: Failed too soon.
customer_reviews.text: I initially LOVED this because it worked so well on grabbing up all those annoying stink bugs (and at a comfortable enough distance away :) ) but it broke way to fast. The self closing doors didn't last 3 days. It's too much of a hassle to get replacement parts...I don't have time for that stuff...isn't that why we shop online in the first place?? PS....if you know there are issues with your product either come up with a better plan or provide additional replacement parts in the original packaging....it would've been a 5-star.
customer_reviews.author: ZooMack

customer_reviews.title: So hard to cock!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second bugzooka. The first one lasted 2.5 years but I had to get replacement parts from the company. This one seems much more well made. It’s longer than the original one and comes with 2 catcher canisters. My issue with it (related to the meh review) is that it’s really hard to get into position/cock. Like, really hard. I’m not a weakling, but holy cow. I’ll have to use it a little longer to see if it loosens up.
customer_reviews.author: CoveredInDogs

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: I'm about to buy this for everyone in my family. It's kind of a must have for every home. Its pretty manual but still amazing. I find bugs icky and now I can get rid of spiders and other creepy without feeling like a pansy by asking others for help. I just got back from a weeklong trip and my place was infested with flies and it was almost a little fun trying to get all of them with the bug Zuka its tough with flying bugs as you have to get right up on them and we should probably have something better in this day and age but for now fully I endorse this product.
customer_reviews.author: Soulie

customer_reviews.title: SUPER EFFECTIVE!
customer_reviews.text: Who would of thought a gizmo like this would be so satisfying!! All gardeners know how slick bugs can be, its like they don't even see the Bugzooka coming at them and then poof their gone!! I LOVE IT!!! Super easy to use, even my 3 yr old nephew goes bug hunting with it. Highly recommend the Bugzooka for gardeners, I'm sure it works well in the house as well but I purchased it for garden use.
customer_reviews.author: RBTX

customer_reviews.title: Effective, yet cumbersome on stinkbugs, but...
customer_reviews.text: Works ok for catching stinkbugs, since they tend to move very slowly, but I can’t see this device being effective in catching any other type of insect. Also, it is really cumbersome to use, and the “trapdoor” part at the end doesn’t seem sturdy, and many other reviewers have stated that this part broke after a short period of time. It’s nice to not have to use batteries, however, and when you get the hang of it, it works fairly well, but probably only for the dreaded stinkbug.
customer_reviews.author: Calliope

customer_reviews.title: I want this to work better
customer_reviews.text: I love the concept. I mostly want to catch the errant fly in the house or yellow jacket trying to grab a bite when we eat outside. While it does work, you really need a semi stable target and you need to be extremely close. I've caught 3 yellow jackets and 1 fly, out of perhaps 100 attempts. I switched back to using a pint glass and my catch rate went back up to 80%. Really cool idea, but limited in application to light bugs that hold still.
customer_reviews.author: Tim F

customer_reviews.title: It Works!
customer_reviews.text: I hate bugs! This one really works. It sucks up any and all crawling insects. I purchased a second one because I no longer travel at a reasonably fast speed and by the time I got back with the BugZooka, the d@mn bug was gone! So now I have one in the bedroom and one in the living. Several friends, upon seeing it in action, asked where I got it. Oh, it is very easy to empty; just unscrew the top and dump out the now-deaseased (just wait a few days from the last “pick-up”).
customer_reviews.author: Miladybug

customer_reviews.title: Great for stink bug removal!
customer_reviews.text: I HATE stink bugs and they always come in in the fall. I just received my BugZooka today and went directly to an infested room to deploy it. It took a couple of tries for me to get the hang of it then worked great! No need for dragging out a heavy vacuum and hooking up the extender tubing. No batteries or electricity needed. I cleared the room in about 3 minutes! I took the device outside and emptied it easily far from my house. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Donna Ambrose

customer_reviews.title: Great low tec way to remove bugs and insects...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is so much fun to use, it seems almost as if it is a toy of some kind. All that aside, the BugZooka really works, will capture annoying insects that make their way into the home. Has no cord and doesn't need charging. Depress the end until it clicks, then hold the other end near the unwanted insect and press the red button. Pop! Your bug is inside. You must cock the BugZooka again to catch another insect. I tried using the wall hanger that comes with it, no good, it wouldn't stick to the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila P.

customer_reviews.title: HIGHLY RECCOMMEND
customer_reviews.text: I bought this at the beginning of the abhorrent stink bug invasion, and this gadget is genius! I caught around 10 stink bugs total and a few spiders. It's very easy to use, has a telescoping nozzle for ceiling crawlers, and it keeps the creatures inside of its compartment. Those disgusting bugs live for a long time so I haven't emptied the compartment yet, but it seems easy enough to do. I HIGHLY recommend this product for those like me who think that bugs "suck" 😉
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: It will even suck up those big-ass crickets and leave them unscathed so ...
customer_reviews.text: I've used this so many times. It will even suck up those big-ass crickets and leave them unscathed so you can just dump them outside. Or, if you just want to get a bug out of the house, but "don't have time for that," you can just throw the canister thing out the door and deal with the bug tomorrow. And even you saving bugs is not your thing, this still reducing the mess of squashing bugs indoors. Ideal for stink bugs because you can suck them up without inducing the stink and either release them or flush them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This Is Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to try and get control of a beetle population that has decided to spend the winter in my house, They have made us crazy every winter for several years. This amazing gadget has gotten rid of 99% of the miserable little bugs. It take some daily work to "zap" them, but also has been pretty entertaining. Some reviews mention that the flap can break after long term usage, but if mine breaks, so what, I have already gotten my moneys worth. Love this thing!
customer_reviews.author: cindersmom

customer_reviews.title: Welp!
customer_reviews.text: Lasted 2 weeks. I was loving this thing it was sucking up all the bad bugs off my veggie plants. I was so happy on early mornings I captured the bad bugs and also when the sun was going down. My plants seemed happy. Then one day it stopped working and I was mad! My husband took a look at it and it's just not fixable. Very disappointed 🙁 I wish I could get a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: I could not live without this
customer_reviews.text: My apartment is attacked by small summer bugs almost every day. This has been a lifesaver. Haven't had an issue with the gate breaking as others have had. Now, they send you an extra with your purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Lexis B

customer_reviews.title: Makes fly catching fun, almost.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift. A year ago I was given one and have enjoyed using it ever since. I live in a rural area surrounded by farmers who don't practice good manure management, so flys periodically become an annoying problem. This thing works better than chasing the critters with a vacuum cleaner. The drawback is you need to wait for the fly to land and then get the nozzle close. They don't fly away like they do when you try to get them with a vacuum cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: C. Henderson

customer_reviews.title: save your money.
customer_reviews.text: This is total garbage. I can’t believe it got so many good reviews. It took 5 attempts to catch the spider because ten suction is so weak. I had to tape the shoot on because it kept falling off. Finally caught the spider and tried to put him outside but he wouldn’t shoot out ! Save your money and just kill the spider or put him in a glass jar to put outside. Anything but this overpriced, cheap, plastic junk.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Assembles and works easily, excellent design, really impressed with it.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, easy to work, and does a very good job. Unless the bug is gripping in a corner with all 6 feet, this thing will suck him up! Very neat clean way to "store" the captured ones while you're working, room for hundreds in there. Easy disposal. Suggest adding an attachment to hook it to a small vacuum cleaner like a Dustbuster for rapid work with hordes of bugs, instead of one-at-a-timing it. Bought another for my mother.
customer_reviews.author: CT reader

customer_reviews.title: Ten stars!
customer_reviews.text: This product is awesome. It’s simple to use. It sucks the bugs in without harming them physically. You get to release them back into the wild (or wherever you choose.) It even comes with a mounting device so you can stow it away when it’s not in use. The Bugzooka is ingeniously designed and well-made. I’d give it 10 stars if I could. Buddhist and would like to easily relocate bugs from inside to outside? Bugzooka is for you. Don’t like getting close to bugs but don’t want to keep them? Bugzooka is for you. Want to experience the unexpected pleasure of sucking a bug into a tube? Bugzooka is for you.
customer_reviews.author: A Safran

customer_reviews.title: Hate It
customer_reviews.text: I'm 64 years old and don't have the strength to use this! I returned the one I ordered. My husband could do it, but I can't. The other thing I hated is that it will only get 1 bug and then you have to do the whole process again. My house is overrun with Stink Bugs at times. Previously I had a battery powered one where I could just run around the ceiling line or wherever & get all of them. I can't find that product now but it eventually failed, too.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Fuchs

customer_reviews.title: It works! Wow
customer_reviews.text: My wife hates dealing with bugs. She's not afraid of them, but the stink bugs have been driving her nuts this past year. I surprised her with this and she has gleefully gone about sucking them up and ridding the house of them. She has also used it on a couple big black ants, a beetle, some spiders, and several gallinippers.
customer_reviews.author: GA Doc

customer_reviews.title: A must have for everyone!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best product ever. We have a lot of scorpions around our house and now it is so easy to remove them without having to get a glass and magazines so I can scoop them without getting stung. The bugzooka is easy as point hit button then take tip outside and release. No batteries or low suction grabs all bugs and you dont have to kill them anymore. Do not leave this page without adding to cart. Your crazy not too. I am a real Amazon customer and I am buying them for my whole family.
customer_reviews.author: michael perry

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't catch a single fly
customer_reviews.text: The suction is pathetic. I tried catching flies for several days, with the tube tip *right* next to a fly, and all activating the vacuum did was give the fly a light breeze that would spook it and make it fly away. Didn't work for a cockroach or a spider either.
customer_reviews.author: Carly Monardo

customer_reviews.title: Effortless Bug Removal
customer_reviews.text: I've had my BugZooka for close to 6 months, and have easily re-located an estimated 30-40 spiders found inside my house, as well as a handful of stink bugs. I know other reviewers have claimed the trap door on these fails, but even if mine failed now, I'd still be happy with the number of bugs removed for the amount paid. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: mikeh80

customer_reviews.title: old model was better
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a new bugzooka as a backup to my one purchased in 2015. It is bug season and I have loved this device since then. This new version is poorly designed with half of the suction power as the original and the end that sucks in the bugs has a significant gap that if left inside the bug could just crawl back out. Why didn't they leave well enough alone. I wish I could get the original design.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Not for flying insects
customer_reviews.text: I do not recommend this device for the purpose for which I purchased it; to catch flies. It might work for catching slow-moving insects on a surface. It could not catch flies in the air or on a surface.
customer_reviews.author: Robert G.

customer_reviews.title: Better than smashing bugs against the wall or taking the vacuum cleaner out.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I had some moths and for a while I was picking them off the wall with a vacuum cleaner, but that's inconvenient and without any guarantee they won't escape it's expensive to keep throwing bags away. Also used the ALPHA QUALITY GOODS Pantry and Clothes Moth Trap, available at Amazon. Between the two - no more moths. Kids love to use this outdoors (can catch and release), but if you're an adult, don't give in to the temptation or you'll be visited by another kind of bug catcher.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Stink bug catcher I’ve used.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had one since they came out, the early models had a hard plastic catch doors with a spring that eventually broke. The new model is slightly smaller limiting suction but have a silicone trap doors that work great. Bought them specifically for stink bugs and they catch without releasing their odor. If you leave them in the trap they dry up and don’t smell.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Toy with no actual function
customer_reviews.text: Sorry, but this did not serve any real purpose. We have these crane flies that have inundated our home. I have to drag the vacuum around with the attachment to reach them. Was hoping for a simpler, lighter solution. By the time you have created the suction and released, the fly has flown away. Plus, there doesn't really seem to be any suction. Great idea, but doesn't live up. Sorry guys!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for getting rid of stink bugs.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the BugZooka to help with a stink bug problem in our home. It works as promised, and the part I really like (and the reason I purchased it) is that I can suck up the smelly little son of a guns without contaminating my vacuum with their smell, or sending the smell back into my house from the vacuum exhaust. I suck them up with the BugZooka and drop them in the toilet. What more could I ask for?
customer_reviews.author: Liveforchocolate

customer_reviews.title: The Best Bug Catcher by far!
customer_reviews.text: I have had another battery powered bug catcher which kind of worked, but the suction was nowhere near as powerful as this one. I threw the battery powered one away after using this one. This one works great on stink bugs and spiders! As long as the bug is on a flat surface it works every time. I would definitely recommend this bug catcher.
customer_reviews.author: lhagen1

customer_reviews.title: Nope nope nope!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Well, this thing is officially garbage. When I got it, I practiced on a few non-living items to get the feel of it. It worked pretty well on a cigarette butt and a leaf and other little bug sized things!! Well I just squared up against my first spider. Absolute fail. I tried to get this guy 3 times. He didn’t even feel the breeze of the bugzooka or whatever the heck this stupid thing is called, let alone any suction!!! Absolutely worthless. I ended up smashing the spider to bits with the end of the tube. Sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Megan McTear

customer_reviews.title: Bought two, one stopped working after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought two. One for either end of our home. We have lots of spiders and I don't want to use chemicals. These work great when they work. One of the two I own stopped working after 4 months. I just came back to see how to contact the seller, and they are no longer available. BTW: I did not store in the cocked position. Advice: Try a different manufacture
customer_reviews.author: Bambooken

customer_reviews.title: The only thing that could be better with this thing is if they would sell the ...
customer_reviews.text: I initially bought this as a novelty and to catch the occasional spider. It has turned into a lifesaver recently when I had a wasps nest under my siding. Some of the wasps (like 40 of em') got in my house. The bugzooka allowed me to remove them without incident. This thing is worth every penny they charge for this. The only thing that could be better with this thing is if they would sell the little doors for the catcher end of this thing separately.
customer_reviews.author: ManOfManyInterests

customer_reviews.title: we are infested with nasty stink bugs and this works great. The only problem is the spring that holds ...
customer_reviews.text: It really works, we are infested with nasty stink bugs and this works great. The only problem is the spring that holds the trap door closed is really thin and the trap door stopped shutting completely after just a week and the nasty things could escape. It really needs to be beefed up a bit. If it hadn't stopped working I would have bought another one so we could have a "his" and "hers" stink bug removal tool. I might have even bought some for gifts they are so neat.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Fields

customer_reviews.title: this thing works great. Sucks those little pests right in
customer_reviews.text: For stinkbugs, asian beetles, hornets who get in the house... any insects that you cannot abide... this thing works great. Sucks those little pests right in! We've had ours a couple of months now with no problems! It's larger than I imagined; we've considered hanging it over our fireplace mantle! I'm joking about that, sort of, but we do keep it close by and give it a place of honor in our home!
customer_reviews.author: L. Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Not as expected
customer_reviews.text: It isn't easy to push into place, the extension tube doesn't stay extended (especially when reaching for a bug) and when we went to empty the pump didn't push the bug out- it held onto the little net for dear life ! Also the suction wasn't very strong & the second bug almost got away while we reloaded.
customer_reviews.author: C.D

customer_reviews.title: Great but broke after only 20 days, then the magic was gone
customer_reviews.text: Broke after only 20 days. The screw on the end of the collapsable, accordion air chamber fell off. The screw held a spring inside the accordion and even though we could re-assemble it there was no more suction. The magic was gone. If it hadn't broken so soon I would have given 5 stars because when it worked it was great.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Massimo

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is AWESOME!!!I had bought the bug vacuums before in the past and none worked. This thing has enough power to suck spiders, ants etc and keep them in the chamber until you empty it. Sometimes though you have to get right on top of the bug to suck it up but 95% of the time you can be up to an inch away. The kids LOVE it too and it also allows for them to examine the bugs in the chamber after they are caught
customer_reviews.author: tonyk

customer_reviews.title: Skip this one
customer_reviews.text: Next to impossible to catch and retain flies. Poor design. Trap door seem to always be wrong. Flies were clearly laughing!
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Love the Bug Zooka
customer_reviews.text: This thing is fantastic. Recently, we were introduced to stink bugs....Ugh. The Bug Zooka is a sanity saver. No more trying to capture stink bugs with a cup and piece of cardboard. We simply aim and it sucks them into the chamber. Depending on where the bug is perched, you may have to try twice. Like other reviewers, we toss the removable chamber in the freezer for an hour and then dump the contents into the toilet bowl. We've also used it for some rogue carpenter ants and a handful of spiders. Very, very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ronin's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Easy and fun to use
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. I'm giving it for Christmas presents this year. Bye Bye Stink Bugs - suck'em up and drop them into soapy water - outside of course. Even using it against a screen, just use care and the bugs are toast. It's pretty close to love in our house - we often 'fight' over who gets to use it next!!!
customer_reviews.author: LT

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: We had an infestation of Indianmeal moths and still had quite a few stragglers to deal with after eliminating their food source. The BugZooka was invaluable for trapping moths that landed on the ceiling. We have 9' ceilings in the kitchen and could easily reach insects that landed there. The suction worked very well for this size of insect and did a great job of capturing them even at an angle if they were above the cabinets or on the wall. Once trapped, no insects escaped. I really like the fact that no batteries are required. I admit to being a little disappointed when stalking around looking for more moths to capture after they were all gone.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Love it but wish it was longer.
customer_reviews.text: I loved this gadget. I have an arbor in the woods and during certain months of the year it becomes over run with spider. First time I used this I honestly caught no less than 500 spiders in a 30 minutes session. And being the bleeding heart that I am this gadget allows me to walk done to the end of the road and release them. My only wish would be that it was about 2 feet longer.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t need batteries and longer than the rechargeable kind
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product for over a year now and it works great! In fact I am ordering my third. To be honest the trap door on the first one broke after only a month or two but I’ve used the second for over a year with no problems and I am buying another to keep on the second floor of our house. Works great for even large Stink Bugs- little to no smell when captured. I like this brand because it’s longer than the others.
customer_reviews.author: Em Deegee

customer_reviews.title: I would definitely recommend it!
customer_reviews.text: Update: the plastic piece that keeps the bugs breaks easily (we have broken two by accidentally dropping them). Maybe because they are used and frozen a lot. You can order those end pieces as replacements. Other than that, this product actually works! We have tried to get rid of wasps using various methods without success until we purchased this BugZooka. You have to get the hang of it. It helps if you jab toward the wasp as you are capturing it. This also works on spiders and can reach areas where you can not. I would definitely recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Price fam

customer_reviews.title: Best thing ever invented
customer_reviews.text: This is the best thing ever made in the history of mankind. It works better than expected. My little daughter can use it to catch the creepy crawlers. Catches all sorts of bugs. Easy to remove stink bugs... no longer have yo squeeze them which causes them to stink up the room. Its awesome.
customer_reviews.author: T. Dyrkacz

customer_reviews.title: Save your money!
customer_reviews.text: I couldn’t seem to make this work so I returned it. I wanted it for spiders and the size than potentially would have fit in the end of the tube I could kill with my hand. Many spoke of using it for stink bugs, the trick for those is dawn dish soap and water in a spray bottle, they die fairly quickly without smashing them or the need for the bugzooka.
customer_reviews.author: Shelley Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: Broke first day!
customer_reviews.text: It broke the first day! Called the phone number to the manufacturer and they had me fill out a warranty . Then the manufacturer said because I bought it on Amazon, I had to call Amazon. Amazon says they will send me a replacement. Let’s see how that goes!
customer_reviews.author: Adria Appleby

customer_reviews.title: Works great, and this new model has  an expandable head.
customer_reviews.text: Newest model has a expandable head, which the old did not, so that is nice for bugs in a higher place. This is my second bugzooka, my old one is working just fine but I wanted one for each floor. I love that I can catch bug and release them without having to kill them, and it's kind of fun to look at the more... odd looking ones. The wall mount it comes with does not mount to the wall with the sticky foam at all... so you have to screw it in.
customer_reviews.author: BobOki

customer_reviews.title: Works fine and has more suction than a battery operated device.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve use this to collect asparagus bugs off of my asparagus plants for about one week, and so far it is working fine. It’s much easier and more effective than collecting by hand because the bugs are wary and drop off the plant as your reach for them. The only reason for four stars, is that it does not have an abundance of suction and therefore only works about 90% of the time.
customer_reviews.author: David Marinelli

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased about four of these, and am responsible for several friends buying some too! This is a great product for catching insects, in my case to catch stink bugs to remove them from my home. I don't like bugs at all, and this allows me to keep my distance from them while capturing them securely. It's easy to use and you can reach bugs that are up higher than you could normally reach :)
customer_reviews.author: shelliecat

product_meta.title: BugZooka WB100 Bug Catcher Vacuum
product_meta.description: Size:One SizeThe Tri Max bazooka is the weapon of choice for the kinder, gentler way to win the war on bugs. It is a fast, simple, fun and safe way to remove bugs from your house, car, or anywhere. The bazooka has instant, powerful suction. No batteries or toxic chemicals are needed.
feature_bullets: BugZooka is a fast, simple, and clean way to rid bugs from your home
The innovative and light weight new BugZooka lets you keep your distance and avoid bug squish and splatter
It's unique patent pending design creates 10X the instant suction of heavy battery powered devices
Bugs are sucked instantly into a removable catch tube with the simple press of a button
Ideal for home, RV, cabin, boat, garden, and kids

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars2,658 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
